meanings.meaning: 1. looking; viewing
2. (please) try (to) Colloquial, Usually written using kana alone, See also 見る, after the -te form of a verb; irreg. imperative conj. of 見る
1. view (of life, etc.); outlook

meanings.type: Noun, Adverb (fukushi), Noun which may take the genitive case particle 'no'
meanings.meaning: 1. the present; present time; now 現在、通常のサービスの早急な復旧に努めています。We are currently working to restore normal service as soon as possible.
2. as of after a time, date, etc.与党は５時現在で５０議席確保している。The ruling party has secured 50 seats as of 5 o'clock.
3. present tense Grammar
4. this world; this life Buddhism, See also 現世
5. to actually exist; to exist right now; to exist right in front of one
6. Present The present (or now) is the time that is associated with ... Read more
見在 【げんざい】
見在: Rarely-used kanji form.

meanings.meaning: 1. to see; to look; to watch; to view; to observe １０ページの５行目をみなさい。Let's begin with the fifth line on page 10.
2. to examine; to look over; to assess; to check; to judge 頭がくらくらしているので、深く考えずにいい加減なことを書いてみる。My head is swimming, so I'll try writing any old stuff without any deep thought.
3. to look after; to attend to; to take care of; to keep an eye on See also 看る私も親の面倒とか見られないですね。I can't look after my parents and such either.
4. to experience; to meet with (misfortune, success, etc.) 映画を観に行かない？Would you like to take in a movie?
5. to try ...; to have a go at ...; to give ... a try Usually written using kana alone, after the -te form of a verb私たちはお互いを理解してみるべきだ。We should try to understand one another.
6. to see (that) ...; to find (that) ... Usually written using kana alone, as 〜てみると, 〜てみたら, 〜てみれば, etc.
観る 【みる】、視る 【みる】
1. to see; to look; to watch; to view; to observe １０ページの５行目をみなさい。Let's begin with the fifth line on page 10.
2. to examine; to look over; to assess; to check; to judge 頭がくらくらしているので、深く考えずにいい加減なことを書いてみる。My head is swimming, so I'll try writing any old stuff without any deep thought.
3. to look after; to attend to; to take care of; to keep an eye on See also 看る私も親の面倒とか見られないですね。I can't look after my parents and such either.
4. to experience; to meet with (misfortune, success, etc.) 映画を観に行かない？Would you like to take in a movie?
5. to try ...; to have a go at ...; to give ... a try Usually written using kana alone, after the -te form of a verb私たちはお互いを理解してみるべきだ。We should try to understand one another.
6. to see (that) ...; to find (that) ... Usually written using kana alone, as 〜てみると, 〜てみたら, 〜てみれば, etc.
観る 【みる】、視る 【みる】

sentences.translation: Let's begin with the fifth line on page 10.
My head is swimming, so I'll try writing any old stuff without any deep thought.
I can't look after my parents and such either.
Would you like to take in a movie?
We should try to understand one another.

meanings.meaning: 1. store; shop; establishment; restaurant
見世 【みせ】
見世: Rarely-used kanji form.
1. store; shop; establishment; restaurant
見世 【みせ】
見世: Rarely-used kanji form.
1. to show; to display あなたに何枚かの写真を見せましょう。I will show you some pictures.
2. to make (something or someone) look ...; to present an appearance of ...
3. to make (something) worth watching; to be entertaining
4. to make a show of (doing); to do in a conspicuous manner; to do in view of others after the -te form of a verb
5. to resolve to do; to do at any cost; to show others that one will ... after the -te form of a verb石にかじりついても成功してみせる。I will succeed at any cost.
1. to show; to display あなたに何枚かの写真を見せましょう。I will show you some pictures.
2. to make (something or someone) look ...; to present an appearance of ...
3. to make (something) worth watching; to be entertaining
4. to make a show of (doing); to do in a conspicuous manner; to do in view of others after the -te form of a verb
5. to resolve to do; to do at any cost; to show others that one will ... after the -te form of a verb石にかじりついても成功してみせる。I will succeed at any cost.

sentences.translation: I will show you some pictures.
I will succeed at any cost.

1. to be seen; to be visible; to be in sight 聖霊がある方の上に下って、その上にとどまられるのが見えたなら、その方こそ聖霊によってバプテスマを授ける方である。The man on whom you see the Spirit come down and remain is he who will baptize with the Holy Spirit.
2. to look; to seem; to appear １１ページの地図はとても奇妙に見える。逆さまにしてみると、見慣れた地図になる。The map on page 11 looks very strange. Turn it upside down. Then it becomes a familiar map to you.
3. to come Honorific or respectful (sonkeigo) languageお留守中に男の方がお見えになりました。A gentleman called in your absence, sir.

1. to be seen; to be visible; to be in sight 聖霊がある方の上に下って、その上にとどまられるのが見えたなら、その方こそ聖霊によってバプテスマを授ける方である。The man on whom you see the Spirit come down and remain is he who will baptize with the Holy Spirit.
2. to look; to seem; to appear １１ページの地図はとても奇妙に見える。逆さまにしてみると、見慣れた地図になる。The map on page 11 looks very strange. Turn it upside down. Then it becomes a familiar map to you.
3. to come Honorific or respectful (sonkeigo) languageお留守中に男の方がお見えになりました。A gentleman called in your absence, sir.

sentences.translation: The man on whom you see the Spirit come down and remain is he who will baptize with the Holy Spirit.
The map on page 11 looks very strange. Turn it upside down. Then it becomes a familiar map to you.
A gentleman called in your absence, sir.

見積り 【みつもり】、見積 【みつもり】
見積: Irregular okurigana usage.
1. to discover; to find (e.g. an error in a book); to come across; to detect; to spot 彼女は物置の中で偶然いくつかの古文書を見つけた。She came across some old documents in the closet.
2. to locate; to find (e.g. something missing); to find fault 僕の弱点を見つけさせないぞ。You won't find my weak point.
3. to be used to seeing; to be familiar with See also 見慣れる
見付ける 【みつける】、見附ける 【みつける】、見附る 【みつける】、見付ける 【みっける】、見附ける 【みっける】、見附る 【みっける】

meanings.meaning: 1. seeing (someone) off; send-off 私は空港へ母を見送りに行った。I went to the airport to see my mother off.

3. letting a pitch go by Baseball
4. wait-and-see attitude Finance

meanings.meaning: 1. splendid; magnificent; excellent; fine; superb; beautiful; admirable 彼のスイングは実に見事だ。He has a perfect swing.
2. utter (esp. defeat); total; complete usu. 見事に
3. something worth seeing; sight; spectacle Archaic
美事 【みごと】

meanings.meaning: 1. visit (to someone affected by illness or misfortune); call; inquiry (about someone's health); expression of sympathy See also お見舞いあなたが病気だと知っていたら、病院へ見舞いに行っただろう。If I had known about your illness, I would have visited you in the hospital.
2. letter of inquiry; letter of sympathy; get-well letter; gift (in token of one's sympathy) See also 見舞い状, See also 見舞い品

1. visit (to someone affected by illness or misfortune); call; inquiry (about someone's health); expression of sympathy See also お見舞いあなたが病気だと知っていたら、病院へ見舞いに行っただろう。If I had known about your illness, I would have visited you in the hospital.
2. letter of inquiry; letter of sympathy; get-well letter; gift (in token of one's sympathy) See also 見舞い状, See also 見舞い品

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to see someone off (at a station, an airport, etc.); to escort (e.g. home) 彼の弟は彼を見送るため駅へ行った。His brother went to the station to see him off.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to follow something with one's eyes until it is out of sight 私たちは彼が見えなくなるまで見送った。We watched him until he was out of sight.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 3. to let pass; to pass up (an opportunity etc.); to let a pitch go by (baseball); to watch a batted ball go into the stands 昇進が見送られた女には働く励みがない。She had no incentive to work after she was refused a promotion.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 4. to shelve (a plan, deliberation on a bill, etc.); to postpone

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 5. to have someone related or close to you die; to bury someone

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 6. to take care of someone until he dies

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 7. to wait and see; to continue (e.g. in legal contexts)

sentences.translation: His brother went to the station to see him off.
We watched him until he was out of sight.
She had no incentive to work after she was refused a promotion.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'u' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to visit and comfort or console; to go to see (e.g. someone in hospital); to ask after (e.g. someone's health); to inquire after 彼は入院中の病気の友人を見舞った。He visited a sick friend who was in the hospital.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'u' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to attack; to hit; to strike; to deal (a punch) マグニチュード５の地震が東京を見舞った。An earthquake of magnitude 5 shook Tokyo.

sentences.translation: He visited a sick friend who was in the hospital.
An earthquake of magnitude 5 shook Tokyo.

meanings.type: Noun, Noun which may take the genitive case particle 'no'

meanings.type: Noun, Noun which may take the genitive case particle 'no'
meanings.meaning: 2. model; example 彼は登山家の良い見本だ。He is a fine type of mountain climber.

sentences.translation: They're giving away samples free.
He is a fine type of mountain climber.
